metadata.title: CVE-2020-15862 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Net-SNMP through 5.8 has Improper Privilege Management because SNMP WRITEaccess to the EXTEND MIB provides the ability to run arbitrary commands asroot.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15862` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsnmp-base - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.6
libsnmp-perl - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.6
libsnmp30 - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.6
python-netsnmp - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.6
snmp - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.6
snmpd - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.6
snmptrapd - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.6
tkmib - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: net-snmp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.6').
